org.apache.geode.experimental.driver

Interface Driver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProtobufDriver

    @Experimental
public interface Driver
    Defines the behaviors of a driver for communicating with a GemFire server by way of the new protocol. This code is an experimental prototype and is presented "as is" with no warranty, suitability, or fitness of purpose implied.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close this Driver, rendering it useless
      FunctionService getFunctionService()
      Creates a new function service or retrieves an extant function service.
      QueryService getQueryService()
      Creates a new query service or retrieves an extant query service.
      <K,V> Region<K,V> getRegion(String regionName)
      Creates an implementation of the region interface for the region with the unique name of regionName.
      Set<String> getRegionNames()
      Retrieves a set of unique names of regions in the GemFire server to which this driver is connected.
      boolean isConnected()
      Is this driver connected?

    • Method Detail

      • getRegionNames

        Set<String> getRegionNames()
                    throws IOException
        Retrieves a set of unique names of regions in the GemFire server to which this driver is connected.
        Returns:
        Set of strings of names that uniquely identify regions.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getRegion

        <K,V> Region<K,V> getRegion(String regionName)
        Creates an implementation of the region interface for the region with the unique name of regionName.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Type of region keys.
        V - Type of region values.
        Parameters:
        regionName - String that uniquely identifies the region.
        Returns:
        the region object

        QueryService getQueryService()
        Creates a new query service or retrieves an extant query service.
        Returns:
        Query service.

      • getFunctionService

        FunctionService getFunctionService()
        Creates a new function service or retrieves an extant function service.
        Returns:
